title: Reflective Activity-Centered Mathematics Learning Design for Web-Based Information Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital information retrieval skills and understanding of middle school-level mathematics
context.additional_context: Web-based information literacy enhancement for mathematical problem-solving targeting corporate managers/leaders, delivered through a blended learning environment combining online platforms and offline workshops

learning_goals: Learners can visualize their cognitive schemas and systematically analyze search strategies during web-based information retrieval.
Through reflective activities (in-action/on-action reflection), learners can improve information retrieval efficiency for mathematical problem-solving by over 30%.
By comparing peers' search processes, learners can derive optimal information retrieval strategies.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
